intro: Saracha erecta, commonly known as the upright saracha, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine. Saracha erecta thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows.
